subSections.title: Glyph origin
Etymology 1
subSections.text: From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*m/s/g-ljak||to lick; tongue}}. The Cantonese vernacular reading ''laai<sup>2</sup>'' preserves the Old Chinese initial ''*l-''.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=shì
|c=saai5,saai2,saai3,si5,si6,laai2
|c_note=saai5, saai2, saai3 (rare), si5 (rare), si6 (rare) - literary; laai2 - vernacular
|c-t=sai4
|h=pfs=sê
|mn=xm,zz,km,sx:chī/qz,jj,ph:chǐ/tp,kh,tn,yl,mg,hc,tc:chīⁿ/lk:chǐⁿ/xm,zz:sī/qz:sǐ
|mn_note=chī/chǐ/chīⁿ/chǐⁿ - vernacular; sī/sǐ - literary
|mc=y
|oc=y
|ma=
|cat=v
}}
